thread.title: Terrorist was a member of the travel and tourism industry
thread.title_full: Terrorist was a member of the travel and tourism industry

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Terrorist was a member of the travel and tourism industry
text:
Terrorist was a member of the travel and tourism industry Adv: 
Jul 06, 2015 Adv: 
The Tunisian jihadist behind the recent massacre of foreign tourists at a seaside resort in Tunisia was a member of the travel and tourism industry when he previously worked in tourism. He was a member of a dance club and was familiar with the tourism sector, having worked in it as an events organizer 
Meanwhile, the mother of the 23-year-old terror suspect Seifeddine Rezgui, insisted her son was "brainwashed", the report said. 
In an interview on Sunday, Prime Minister Habib Essid revealed more details about Rezgui, who gunned down 38 foreign tourists in the June 26 attack. Tourists fled in horror as Rezgui pulled a Kalashnikov assault rifle from inside a furled beach umbrella and went on a shooting spree outside a five-star hotel. 
Authorities and relatives later described him as having been an apparently normal young man who had been keen on breakdancing. 
The terrorist mother wanted the world to know: "God bless the victims, all those people and their poor families, and I feel so sorry but I want to tell them it wasn't my son who did this, it was another Seifeddine," she said. 
The attack on the beach and around the swimming pools of the Riu Imperial Marhaba Hotel was claimed by the Islamic State group. 
Authorities have admitted that the transformation of an apparently normal young man caused amazement in Tunisia. 
Essid pledged to La Presse "substantive work... on culture and education", in addition to economic reforms. 
ISIS has encouraged its followers to carry out attacks during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.
